name: zinc monosulfate production | zinc monosulfate | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4552/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of solid zinc monosulfate powder. Direct uses of zinc sulfate are the following: ;- Precipitating baths for viscose manufacture;- Electrolytes for galvanizing baths;- Additive (trace element) in fertilizers and animal feeds;- In medicine, as an emetic, astringent, or disinfectant;- Wood preservative, additive for paper bleaching, flocculant;- Water treatment;- Ore flotation;- Rayon spinning;This dataset represents an estimation of the production process of zinc monosulfate and should be used only for processes where the impact of this substance is not considered to be high. The main data are taken from Rohe et al. (2014). The raw material inputs are calculated according to stoichiometry. The emissions to air and water are estimated using mass balance.;References:;Hischier R., Classen M., Lehmann M. and Scharnhorst W. (2007) Life cycle inventories of Electric and Electronic Equipment: Production, Use and Disposal. ecoinvent report No. 18. Empa / Technology & Society Lab, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, 2007.;Rohe, D. M. M., Battersby, R. V. and Wolf, H. U. 2014. Zinc Compounds. Ullmann's Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry. 1–8.

From reception of raw materials at the factory gate.

This dataset includes raw materials and chemicals used for production, estimated emissions to air and water from production (incomplete), and estimated energy demand and infrastructure of the plant (approximation). Solid wastes are omitted.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The data used has no specific geographical origin as it is based on stoechiometric calculations and estimations. It is assumed to be representative of the production processes in this geography.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Production out of zinc oxide and sulphuric acid, assuming a yield of 95%. Zinc sulphate monohydrate is produced either by thermal dehydration or by dehydrating with 95% ethanol.;Reference:;Hischier R., Classen M., Lehmann M. and Scharnhorst W. (2007) Life cycle inventories of Electric and Electronic Equipment: Production, Use and Disposal. ecoinvent report No. 18. Empa / Technology & Society Lab, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, 2007.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Process data based on stoichiometry. Process emissions are based on estimations only.

exchanges.description:
Zinc monosulphate, also called zinc sulphate monohydrate, is a white powder.
Direct uses of zinc sulfate are the following: 
- Precipitating baths for viscose manufacture
- Electrolytes for galvanizing baths
- Additive (trace element) in fertilizers and animal feeds
- In medicine, as an emetic, astringent, or disinfectant
- Wood preservative, additive for paper bleaching, flocculant
- Water treatment
- Ore flotation
- Rayon spinning

References:
Hischier R., Classen M., Lehmann M. and Scharnhorst W. (2007) Life cycle inventories of Electric and Electronic Equipment: Production, Use and Disposal. ecoinvent report No. 18. Empa / Technology & Society Lab, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, 2007.
Rohe, D. M. M., Battersby, R. V. and Wolf, H. U. 2014. Zinc Compounds. Ullmann's Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry. 1–8.

exchanges.description:
For the zinc oxide input, it is assumed that 80% of the surplus input is internally recovered, while the re-maining 20% are emitted into air.

Reference: 
Hischier R., Classen M., Lehmann M. and Scharnhorst W. (2007) Life cycle inventories of Electric and Electronic Equipment: Production, Use and Disposal. ecoinvent report No. 18. Empa / Technology & Society Lab, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, 2007.

flow.name: Zinc II
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description: Calculated Value, based on a process efficiency of 95%. As a process uses enough (process) water, an additional water consumption of 50% is taken into account.

Calculated based on literature data published by the industry. For this activity, no information was readily available concerning infrastructure and land-use. Therefore, the infrastructure is estimated based on data from two chemical factories, the BASF site of Ludwigshafen and the chemical factory in Gendorf (which are both located in Germany), which produce a wide range of chemical substances. Based on this data, the following assumptions are made: the built area amounts to about 4.2 ha, the plant has an average output of 50'000 t/a and a lifespan of fifty years. The estimated infrastructure amount is therefore 4.00 E-10 units per kg of produced chemical.

References:
Althaus H.-J., Chudacoff M., Hischier R., Jungbluth N., Osses M. and Primas A. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Chemicals. ecoinvent report No. 8, v2.0. EMPA Dübendorf, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, CH.
Gendorf (2000) Umwelterklärung 2000, Werk Gendorf. Werk Gendorf, Burgkirchen.

exchanges.description: For sulfuric acid, the air emissions occurring were assumed to be 0.2% of the raw material input. The remaining amount of unreacted sulfuric acid was assumed to leave the production process with the wastewater.

For sulfuric acid, the air emissions occurring were assumed to be 0.2% of the raw material input. The remaining amount of unreacted sulfuric acid was assumed to leave the production process with the wastewater.
